Description: Wheelmade ovoid pottery jar with a rounded base, convex sides widening to the shoulder, elongated neck 7.1cm tall, and a restricted rim measuring 6.4cm diameter. Jar is covered with an orange wash that fades to grey in places and goes inside the rim. Two dark brown painted lines below the neck and two on the shoulder create a frieze; within, are four jackals in dark brown paint, sat on hind legs with tail erect, each holding a large leaf. One is larger than the others and spans halfway down the body of the pot.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 82) (Type W37)
